//notes: this pouch is 'tall', and thus able to reliably hold extended-capacity box magazines
description: A nylon pouch for a single rifle magazine.  Will fit many, though not all, rifle magazines.

variants.description: A nylon pouch fit for a single STANAG magazine.  When stored, 30-round standard magazines poke out of the top, where it's secured with an elastic band.  This pouch design makes it that much faster to use than a closed-top design with a flap.  Has PALS webbing on the front, fit for the same pouch or something smaller.  <variant_multicam>

A nylon pouch fit for a single STANAG magazine.  When stored, 30-round standard magazines poke out of the top, where it's secured with an elastic band.  This pouch design makes it that much faster to use than a closed-top design with a flap.  Has PALS webbing on the front, fit for the same pouch or something smaller.  <variant_black>

A nylon pouch fit for a single STANAG magazine.  When stored, 30-round standard magazines poke out of the top, where it's secured with an elastic band.  This pouch design makes it that much faster to use than a closed-top design with a flap.  Has PALS webbing on the front, fit for the same pouch or something smaller.  <variant_coyote>

A nylon pouch fit for a single STANAG magazine.  When stored, 30-round standard magazines poke out of the top, where it's secured with an elastic band.  This pouch design makes it that much faster to use than a closed-top design with a flap.  Has PALS webbing on the front, fit for the same pouch or something smaller.  <variant_ranger>

description: A nylon pouch fit for a single STANAG magazine and a single pistol magazine.  Not as quick to use as two separate pouches, but takes up fewer slots on the webbing.

variants.description: A nylon pouch fit for a single STANAG magazine and a single pistol magazine.  When stored, standard-length magazines poke out of the top.  Rifle magazines are secured with an elastic band, while pistol magazines are covered with a flap.  This design trades some quickness of use for covenience, since it allows you to carry magazines for both your rifle and your backup pistol in less space than two separate pouches would take.  <variant_multicam>

A nylon pouch fit for a single STANAG magazine and a single pistol magazine.  When stored, standard-length magazines poke out of the top.  Rifle magazines are secured with an elastic band, while pistol magazines are covered with a flap.  This design trades some quickness of use for covenience, since it allows you to carry magazines for both your rifle and your backup pistol in less space than two separate pouches would take.  <variant_black>

A nylon pouch fit for a single STANAG magazine and a single pistol magazine.  When stored, standard-length magazines poke out of the top.  Rifle magazines are secured with an elastic band, while pistol magazines are covered with a flap.  This design trades some quickness of use for covenience, since it allows you to carry magazines for both your rifle and your backup pistol in less space than two separate pouches would take.  <variant_coyote>

A nylon pouch fit for a single STANAG magazine and a single pistol magazine.  When stored, standard-length magazines poke out of the top.  Rifle magazines are secured with an elastic band, while pistol magazines are covered with a flap.  This design trades some quickness of use for covenience, since it allows you to carry magazines for both your rifle and your backup pistol in less space than two separate pouches would take.  <variant_olive>

//max_contains_weight: weight of an M1911 magazine: 0.156 lbs = 70.76 g ≈ 71 g
plus weight of 8 rounds of ball .45 ACP: 331 gr (= 21.448 g = 22 g) × 8 = 171.59 g ≈ 172 g
//max_contains_volume: might be able to fit in a slightly-larger magazine
pocket_data.//min_item_length: slightly shorter than length of pouch (3.65 in. ≈ 92 mm)
//max_item_length: 5.1 in., slightly longer than loaded M1911 mag

//flags: replaced PALS_MEDIUM with PALS_SMALL (aligns with other single-rifle-magazine pouches)

//notes: it appears as though the shell holder is not inherent to the pouch or is removable
photos of the pouch show a 5.56mm insert inside the pouch
we model the pouch as if the shell holder is inherent and the listed ammo are compatible with it in some fashion
description: A long nylon pouch, intended to hold up to 12 shotgun shells.  The flap keeps the shells shielded from the elements.

variants.description: A long nylon pouch, intended to hold up to 12 shotgun shells, or ammunition of similar calibers.  The flap keeps the shells shielded from the elements.  There is a strip of hook-and-loop surface, for sticking morale patches onto.  <variant_multicam>

A long nylon pouch, intended to hold up to 12 shotgun shells, or ammunition of similar calibers.  The flap keeps the shells shielded from the elements.  There is a strip of hook-and-loop surface, for sticking morale patches onto.  <variant_black>

A long nylon pouch, intended to hold up to 12 shotgun shells, or ammunition of similar calibers.  The flap keeps the shells shielded from the elements.  There is a strip of hook-and-loop surface, for sticking morale patches onto.  <variant_coyote>

A long nylon pouch, intended to hold up to 12 shotgun shells, or ammunition of similar calibers.  The flap keeps the shells shielded from the elements.  There is a strip of hook-and-loop surface, for sticking morale patches onto.  <variant_olive>

notes: length is average height of patch, for pseudo-area calculations

//flags: replaced BELTED and OVERSIZE with CANT_WEAR

description: A set of six rifle magazine pouches in a single pouch.  Named so because it has two rows of pouches stacked over one another.  The front row is quicker to use, but doesn't hold larger magazines.

variants.description: A set of six sewn-together STANAG magazine pouches.  The front row is noticably shorter, so while these pouches are quicker to draw from, they don't allow larger-than-standard magazines in.  Each front pouch has its own small PALS webbing.  <variant_multicam>

A set of six sewn-together STANAG magazine pouches.  The front row is noticably shorter, so while these pouches are quicker to draw from, they don't allow larger-than-standard magazines in.  Each front pouch has its own small PALS webbing.  <variant_black>

A set of six sewn-together STANAG magazine pouches.  The front row is noticably shorter, so while these pouches are quicker to draw from, they don't allow larger-than-standard magazines in.  Each front pouch has its own small PALS webbing.  <variant_coyote>

A set of six sewn-together STANAG magazine pouches.  The front row is noticably shorter, so while these pouches are quicker to draw from, they don't allow larger-than-standard magazines in.  Each front pouch has its own small PALS webbing.  <variant_olive>

//flags: replaced BELTED and OVERSIZE with CANT_WEAR
replaced PALS_SMALL with PALS_LARGE: takes up three slots

//notes: the pouch is shown to be able to comfortably hold a 30-round MP5 magazine, but anything longer would likely sway too much to sit comfortably
description: A thin nylon pouch for holding a single pistol magazine.  Being of open-top design, it's quicker to operate than those with flaps.

variants.description: A thin nylon pouch with a flexible retention cord.  It is quicker to operate than those pouches that close with a flap.  Can store a single pistol magazine, including some of the extended ones.  <variant_multicam>

A thin nylon pouch with a flexible retention cord.  It is quicker to operate than those pouches that close with a flap.  Can store a single pistol magazine, including some of the extended ones.  <variant_multicam_black>

A thin nylon pouch with a flexible retention cord.  It is quicker to operate than those pouches that close with a flap.  Can store a single pistol magazine, including some of the extended ones.  <variant_black>

A thin nylon pouch with a flexible retention cord.  It is quicker to operate than those pouches that close with a flap.  Can store a single pistol magazine, including some of the extended ones.  <variant_coyote>

A thin nylon pouch with a flexible retention cord.  It is quicker to operate than those pouches that close with a flap.  Can store a single pistol magazine, including some of the extended ones.  <variant_ranger>

A thin nylon pouch with a flexible retention cord.  It is quicker to operate than those pouches that close with a flap.  Can store a single pistol magazine, including some of the extended ones.  <variant_grey>

notes: negative trim is to account for the extra parts (the cord etc.)

pocket_data.//max_contains_weight: large-enough to accomodate a full SMG magazine
pocket_data.//min_item_length: roughly half the length of the pouch

//notes: this pouch is restrictive in volume and length because of the flap
description: A nylon pouch fit for a pistol magazine.  The flap keeps the magazine soundly in place, but operating it is slower than the open-top alternatives.

name.str: MOLLE II older pistol mag pouch
name.str_pl: MOLLE II older pistol mag pouches

variants.description: An older, faded nylon pouch.  Can store a single pistol magazine, originally intended for the previously standard-issue M9 magazines.  The snap button on the flap makes the pouch slower to operate than the newer hook-and-loop flap on the M17 magazine pouch.  <variant_acu>.

//longest_side: no longest side, since the pouch appears to be easily-foldable

//notes: this pouch is slightly-less-restrictive in volume and length because of the Velcro flap, but is still restricted to medium-capacity pistol magazines
description: A nylon pouch with a hook-and-loop flap.  Can store a single pistol magazine.  A newer design for the newer standard-issue army pistol magazines.

variants.description: A thin nylon pouch with a hook-and-loop flap.  Can store a single pistol magazine.  Originally designed to hold magazines for M17, the standard-issue pistol in the U.S. Army before the Cataclysm.  The flap is quicker to operate than the previous snap-button design, but not as quick as the open-top alternatives. <variant_multicam>.

notes: even though the pouch appears to be rigid, we model it as being able to fold depth-wise, for storage purposes

description: A nylon pouch for storing an SMG magazine.  Also fits extended SMG magazines.

variants.description: A thin nylon pouch for storing a single SMG magazine.  Fits most regular and extended SMG magazines.  <variant_multicam>
A thin nylon pouch for storing a single SMG magazine.  Fits most regular and extended SMG magazines.  <variant_black>

pocket_data.//max_contains_volume: just above the volume of MP5 40-round magazine

description: A nylon pouch for storing a single large magazine.

variants.description: A nylon pouch for storing a single magazine in .308/7.62×51mm NATO caliber.  Fits magazines up to 30 rounds in capacity.  <variant_multicam>
A nylon pouch for storing a single magazine in .308/7.62×51mm NATO caliber.  Fits magazines up to 30 rounds in capacity.  <variant_coyote>
A nylon pouch for storing a single magazine in .308/7.62×51mm NATO caliber.  Fits magazines up to 30 rounds in capacity.  <variant_black>
A nylon pouch for storing a single magazine in .308/7.62×51mm NATO caliber.  Fits magazines up to 30 rounds in capacity.  <variant_ranger>

//longest_side: no longest side, since the pouch appears to be easily-foldable

//notes: the description says it can hold a standard (20-round) 7.62mm NATO magazine, which appears to be impossible without some strong imbalance
with that said, the description also advertises an internal grip surface
description: A nylon pouch for a single .338 sniper rifle magazine.  Can also hold some .308 and 7.62mm magazines.

variants.description: A small nylon pouch intended to hold a single .338 Lapua 5-round magazine, or a magazines of similar size.  Produced by Warrior Assault Systems.  The plastic buckle keeps the magazine securely in place, but also makes it somewhat slower to operate than open-top alternatives.  <variant_multicam>

A small nylon pouch intended to hold a single .338 Lapua 5-round magazine, or a magazines of similar size.  Produced by Warrior Assault Systems.  The plastic buckle keeps the magazine securely in place, but also makes it somewhat slower to operate than open-top alternatives.  <variant_coyote>

A small nylon pouch intended to hold a single .338 Lapua 5-round magazine, or a magazines of similar size.  Produced by Warrior Assault Systems.  The plastic buckle keeps the magazine securely in place, but also makes it somewhat slower to operate than open-top alternatives.  <variant_atacs_fg>

notes: relatively-large height accounts for to the buckle
large trim accounts for the space outside of the buckle on the same plane

//longest_side: 1 in., the presumed width/height of the buckle, which cannot collapse even if the rest of the pouch can
